vault.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a room with thick walls and a strong door where money, jewels etc are kept to prevent them from being stolen or damaged
vault.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a room where people from the same family are buried, often under the floor of a church
vault.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a roof or ceiling that consists of several arches that are joined together, especially in a church
vault.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to jump over something in one movement, using your hands or a pole to help you
vault.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The robber vaulted over the counter and took $200 in cash.
vault.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to move quickly from a lower rank or level to a higher one
vault.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: On Sunday Michigan vaulted from No. 4 to the nationâ€™s top team.
vault.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: part of a bank or other organization where money is kept safely
vault.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: More than $425 million currently sit in vaults in the Treasury Department.
vault.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to move into a higher or more successful position
vault.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The Hang Seng Index vaulted 2.6% to 3722.39.
The acquisition vaulted the company to the top of the workstation market.
